thread.title: Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7
thread.title_full: Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7

title: Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7 Playing as a ranked team for the first time since 2011, the Cougars (6-0, 3-0 American Athletic) won by at least 21 points for the fourth time this season Post to Facebook Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7 Playing as a ranked team for the first time since 2011, the Cougars (6-0, 3-0 American Athletic) won by at least 21 points for the fourth time this season   KHOU.com: http://on.khou.com/1LzLdon   Join the Conversation To   Greg Ward Jr. leads No. 24 Houston past Tulane, 42-7 Associated Press 7:54 a.m. CDT October 17, 2015 Greg Ward Jr. ran for three touchdowns and threw a scoring pass to help No. 24 Houston beat Tulane 42-7 on Friday night Oct 16, 2015; New Orleans, LA, USA; Houston Cougars quarterback Greg Ward Jr. (1) tosses the ball to wide receiver Demarcus Ayers (10) who scored a touchdown on the reverse play against the Tulane Green Wave during the second quarter of a game at Yulman Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Derick E. Hingle, Derick E. Hingle-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS (AP) - Greg Ward Jr. ran for three touchdowns and threw a scoring pass to help No. 24 Houston beat Tulane 42-7 on Friday night. 
Playing as a ranked team for the first time since 2011, the Cougars (6-0, 3-0 American Athletic) won by at least 21 points for the fourth time this season. 
Despite three starting offensive linemen sitting out with injuries, Houston piled up 461 total yards, including 239 on the ground, and went 7 of 15 on third down. Ward passed for 222 yards and ran for 77. 
Houston held Tulane (2-4, 1-2) to 262 total yards and forced 11 punts. Devin Powell started for the Green Wave with Tanner Lee out after sustaining a concussion a week ago against Temple, and completed just 11 passes for 88 yards.
